wikipedia_page.main: James McKie was a Scottish footballer who played as a full-back for Southampton St. Mary's in 1896–97, when they won the Southern League title for the first of six occasions over the next eight years.

response: *James McKie (footballer, born 1873) (1873–?), Scottish footballer who played in the 1890s for Southampton, Chatham and Dartford
*James McKie (businessman) (1859–1910), Scottish businessman with Jardine, Matheson and Co.
*James McKie (publisher) (1816–1891), Scottish publisher and collector of Robert Burns' works
